title: Blended library science practical competency enhancement course

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Library Management and Understanding of Information Services
context.additional_context: Practical work-centered education for professionals, including activities feasible in restricted technological environments (primarily smartphone-based)

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish and explain the four types of hybrid librarianship models: transcending, partial, intermittent, and aspirational.
Learners can analyze on-site library work experiences by applying phenomenological research methodologies.
Learners can apply fundamental principles for designing mobile-based information services in resource-constrained technical environments.
Learners can propose strategies for building collaborative networks to support hybrid librarianship practices.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
